entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal gets bail, but Supreme Court split on legality of CBI's arrest Live UpdatesArvind Kejriwal Bail Order: The two Supreme Court judges delivered separate but concurring judgments. While Justice Surya Kant held Arvind Kejriwal's arrest valid, Justice Bhuyan called it 'unjustified'.

CBI must show it's uncaged parrot: Supreme Court judge on Arvind Kejriwal arrestArvind Kejriwal was first arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on March 21 in a money laundering case connected to the liquor policy scam. The CBI arrested him later on June 26 in a corruption case.

Man shot 8 times outside gym in posh Delhi locality, murder on CCTVIn the CCTV footage, accessed by India Today, Nadir Shah is seen talking to another man while standing next to a black SUV before being shot multiple times.

Sunita Williams undergoes eye checks ahead of calling home tonightWilliams and Wilmore, who launched aboard Boeing's Starliner spacecraft on June 5, 2024, have been part of an unexpected turn of events.

Arvind Kejriwal bail conditions: Can't enter Chief Minister's office, sign filesThe Supreme Court set certain conditions while granting bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the liquor policy case. He has been in jail since April 1.

Rain in Greater Noida leads to first abandoned Test match in 28 yearsThe one-off Test match between Afghanistan and New Zealand became only the 8th Test match in cricketing history to be abandoned without any ball being bowled. Persistent rain in Greater Noida played spoilsport on all five days of the Test match.

Elon Musk shares Haitian woman's video to back Trump's 'eating pets' claimThe post by Elon Musk comes as several media outlets are fact-checking claims made by Donald Trump that illegal immigrants from Haiti were eating pets in an Ohio city.

Loyal dog chases ambulance carrying owner. Video ends on a heartwarming note In a viral video, a loyal dog was seen chasing an ambulance carrying its ailing owner to the hospital. What happened next is absolutely heartwarming.

Ex-Miss Switzerland finalist murdered by husband, body parts 'pureed' in a blenderKristina Joksimovic, a former Miss Switzerland finalist, was allegedly murdered by her husband, who dismembered her body. Victim's husband named Thomas, confessed to the killing, claiming self-defense.

Malaika Arora holds back tears as she leaves father's home with Arjun Kapoor, AmritaMalaika Arora was looking visibly emotional as she left her late father's home with sister Amrita Arora and Arjun Kapoor. Her father, Anil Mehta, died after jumping from their balcony.

Lady Macbeth of Bengal: Governor vows to 'socially boycott' Mamata BanerjeeWest Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose on Thursday said he will not share any public platform with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, citing the public outcry over the Kolkata doctor's rape-murder.

Alia Bhatt, Diljit Dosanjh reunite for Jigra, fans say 'Ikk Kudi duo is back'Alia Bhatt and Diljit Dosanjh are reuniting for the former's upcoming film Jigra. Alia shared the exciting news on Instagram, reigniting memories of their previous collaboration in Udta Punjab.
OpenAI o1 is here, a new Strawberry AI model that thinks before respondingOpenAI has released a new o1 AI model. The smarter but expensive model is available for only ChatGPT Plus and Team users.

Rapper Badshah calls Rs 8 crore Rolls Royce 'bakwas': No car is better than SwiftBadshah reveals he owns 1,000 sneakers, including a Rs 22 lakh Nike Yeezy 2. He also calls his Rs 8 crore Rolls Royce 'rubbish'.

'No politician as honest as Kejriwal', says AAP leader Manish SisodiaArvind Kejriwal Bail Plea Verdict, Delhi Excise Policy Live Updates: The Supreme Court has granted bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the alleged liquor policy scam case. The court delivered two separate verdicts, one each on Kejriwal's bail plea and on his arrest by the CBI. While  Justice Surya Kant held Kejriwal's CBI arrest valid, Justice Ujjal Bhuyan called it 'unjustified'. However, both the judges set the Delhi High Court order upholding Kejriwal's arrest aside and granted him bail.

Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR, several roads waterlogged, more showers in storeThe weather department has issued an orange alert for Delhi-NCR, indicating a "be prepared" mode. The alert warns of potential disruptions to transport, including rail, road and air, with power outages also likely.

Nagpur Audi crash: CCTV footage of bar visited by BJP leader's son missing Sanket Bawankule's Audi, allegedly driven by his friend Arjun Hawre, hit several vehicles in Ramdaspeth in the early hours of Monday, leaving two persons on a moped injured.

1 terror associate arrested in J&K's Poonch, huge cache of explosives seizedSecurity forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district arrested a terror associate and recovered three grenades, explosives and other incriminating documents.

His troubles against the short deliveries continued as left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed dismissed him on Friday morning in Anantapur.

Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag responds to Cristiano Ronaldo commentsManchester United boss Erik ten Hag has responded to the criticism from Cristiano Ronaldo and said that the Portuguese superstar is far away from Manchester at the moment.

Balbirnie dropped for T20Is as Ireland name squad for South Africa seriesIreland have named their white-ball squads for the upcoming series against South Africa in the UAE. Test captain Andrew Balbirnie wasn't picked in the T20I squad and will open the batting in ODIs.

Anwar Ali, East Bengal move Delhi HC, seek stay on player's suspension by AIFFIndia defender Anwar Ali, along with East Bengal and Delhi FC, has moved the Delhi High Court seeking a stay on the AIFF's suspension. The suspension was imposed for 'illegally terminating' his contract with Mohun Bagan and included a hefty compensation demand.

Watch: Smriti Mandhana dazzles in brand new advertisement with SRK Smriti Mandhana, Shah Rukh Khan, Shafali Verma and Jemimah Rodrigues featured in a latest advertisement. Shafali, Mandhana and Jemimah will also take part in the Women's T20 World Cup 2024.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
